Replace.Text: [COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_AMBIORIX_NEIGHBOR_COMBAT_BONUS_DESCRIPTION]Receive +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each adjacent unit (King of the Eburones)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_AMBIORIX_NEIGHBOR_COMBAT_BONUS_NAME]Ambiorix

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_BYZANTIUM_COMBAT_UNITS_DESCRIPTION]Receive +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each Holy City converted to your Religion and Byzantium's Religion is spread to nearby cities when a major civilization's unit is defeated (Taxis)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_BYZANTIUM_COMBAT_UNITS_NAME]Holy City Combat
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_BYZANTIUM_RELIGIOUS_UNITS_DESCRIPTION]Receive +3 [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Strength for each Holy City converted to your Religion.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_BYZANTIUM_RELIGIOUS_UNITS_NAME]Holy City Religious Strength
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_DROMON_COMBAT_STRENGTH_AGAINST_UNITS_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength against units.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_DROMON_DESCRIPTION]Receive +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against units.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_DROMON_NAME]Greek Fire
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_ENABLE_WALL_ATTACK_SAME_RELIGION_DESCRIPTION]Does full damage against cities following the same religion as Byzantium (Porphyrogénnētos)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_ENABLE_WALL_ATTACK_SAME_RELIGION_NAME]Porphyrogénnētos
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_FREE_RESOURCE_MAITENANCE_HIPPODROME_DESCRIPTION]This unit does not cost Strategic Resources per turn from the Hippodrome district.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_FREE_RESOURCE_MAITENANCE_HIPPODROME_NAME]Hippodrome
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_GAESATAE_COMBAT_DISTRICTS_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_GAESATAE_COMBAT_STRENGTH_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength against units with a higher base Combat Strength.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_GAESATAE_DESCRIPTION]Receive +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against units with a higher base Combat Strength. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_GAESATAE_NAME]Gaesatae
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_COMBAT_STRENGTH_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength when within 1 tile of the Tagma.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_DESCRIPTION]Land units within 1 tile of the Tagma receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Strength.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_NAME]Tagma
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_NONRELIGIOUS_COMBAT_DESCRIPTION]+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when within 1 tile of the Tagma.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_NONRELIGIOUS_COMBAT_NAME]Tagma Combat Strength
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_RELIGIOUS_COMBAT_DESCRIPTION]+4 [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Strength when within 1 tile of the Tagma.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_RELIGIOUS_COMBAT_NAME]Tagma Religious Strength
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_TAGMA_RELIGIOUS_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} Religious Strength when within 1 tile of the Tagma.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_BYZANTIUM_ADJECTIVE]Byzantine
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_BYZANTIUM_DESCRIPTION]Byzantine Empire
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_BYZANTIUM_NAME]Byzantium
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_GAUL_ADJECTIVE]Gallic
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_GAUL_DESCRIPTION]Gallic Empire
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_GAUL_NAME]Gaul
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_COMBAT_PREVIEW_NEIGHBOR_COMBAT_BONUS_DESC]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength from the King of the Eburones trait
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_COMBAT_PREVIEW_NUMBER_HOLY_CITIES_CONVERTED_BONUS_DESC]+{1_Amount} Combat Strength from the Taxis trait
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_COMBAT_PREVIEW_NUMBER_HOLY_CITIES_CONVERTED_RELIGIOUS_BONUS_DESC]+{1_Amount} Religious Strength from the Taxis trait
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_HIPPODROME_CULTURE]+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from the adjacent Hippodrome district.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_HIPPODROME_DESCRIPTION]A district unique to Byzantium. Replaces the Entertainment Complex district, provides +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, and is cheaper to build. When the Hippodrome and buildings in this district are constructed, receive a Heavy Cavalry unit.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_HIPPODROME_EXPANSION1_DESCRIPTION]A district unique to Byzantium. Replaces the Entertainment Complex district, provides +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, and is cheaper to build. When the Hippodrome and buildings in this district are constructed, receive a Heavy Cavalry unit. Cannot be built in a city with a Water Park.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_HIPPODROME_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION]A district unique to Byzantium. Replaces the Entertainment Complex district, provides +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, and is cheaper to build. When the Hippodrome and buildings in this district are constructed, receive a Heavy Cavalry unit. Units granted from this district do not have a resource maintenance cost. Cannot be built in a city with a Water Park.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_HIPPODROME_NAME]Hippodrome

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_OPPIDUM_DESCRIPTION]A district unique to Gaul that is cheaper and available earlier than the district it replaces, the Industrial Zone. The Oppidum district is defensible with a ranged attack. When the first Oppidum is constructed the Apprenticeship technology is unlocked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Production] Production adjacency bonus from Quarries and strategic resources.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DISTRICT_OPPIDUM_NAME]Oppidum

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_GAMEMODE_DRAMATICAGES_DESCRIPTION]This game mode makes Dark Ages and Golden Ages more potent than ever. Heroic Ages are removed, and players can only be in a Normal Age in the first era. After that, they will either earn a Dark or a Golden Age.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Instead of making Dedications, players get access to powerful new Social Policies based on their Age. Dark Policies make a return with refreshed powerful effects. Brand new Golden Policies are available to those who make it to a Golden Age. To keep earning Era Score, complete Techs and Civics and earn military unit promotions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dark Ages are particularly dangerous. Players in Dark Ages will have a portion of their empire immediately fall into Free Cities, and Free Cities can exert pressure on other cities. On easier difficulty settings, AI players lose a lot of cities. On harder difficulty settings, human players do. On Prince, they lose an equal amount.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Georgia's civilization unique ability is brand new, to match the mode's unique rules.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_GAMEMODE_DRAMATICAGES_NAME]Dramatic Ages Mode
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LEADER_AMBIORIX_NAME]Ambiorix
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LEADER_BASIL_NAME]Basil II

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LOADING_INFO_LEADER_AMBIORIX]Your wits will serve you well, Ambiorix. Where the size of your armies fail, use your head and gilded tongue to reclaim your land. Your allies will follow your lead and your strong spear arm will shatter the resistance of your enemies. Fight, great warrior-king!

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LOADING_INFO_LEADER_BASIL]Your enemies will fear you, King Basil II, for you were forged in the fire. Let your cunning and ambition sharpen your blade. Protect your pride and stand against your foes, both within your walls and beyond.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MAP_HIGHLANDS_DESCRIPTION]A large region dominated by hills and mountain ranges.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_MAP_HIGHLANDS_NAME]Highlands

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_BYZANTIUM_DESCRIPTION]Units receive +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength for each Holy City converted to Byzantium's Religion (including Byzantium's Holy City). Byzantium's Religion is spread to nearby cities when defeating a unit belonging to an enemy civilization or city-state. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities with a Holy Site district.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_BYZANTIUM_NAME]Taxis

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_DRAMATIC_AGE_QUESTS_DESCRIPTION]While in a Golden Age, gains an extra Wildcard Policy Slot, and may use Dark Age Policies. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards defensive buildings.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_GAUL_DESCRIPTION]Mines provide a minor adjacency bonus for all districts, a Culture Bomb of unowned territory, and receive +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Specialty districts do not receive a minor adjacency for being adjacent to another district and these districts cannot be built adjacent to the City Center.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_GAUL_NAME]Hallstatt Culture

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_AMBIORIX_DESCRIPTION]Your civilization gains [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 20% of the unit’s cost when a non-civilian is trained. Melee, Anti-Cavalry, and Ranged Units receive +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every adjacent unit.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_AMBIORIX_NAME]King of the Eburones

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_BASIL_DESCRIPTION]Heavy and Light Cavalry units do full damage against cities following the same religion as Byzantium. Gain the Tagma unique unit when the Divine Right civic is discovered.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_BASIL_NAME]Porphyrogénnētos

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_BYZANTINE_DROMON_DESCRIPTION]Byzantine unique Classical era unit that replaces the Quadrireme that has additional range and receives +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against units.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_BYZANTINE_DROMON_NAME]Dromon

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_BYZANTINE_TAGMA_DESCRIPTION]Basil II's unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Land units within 1 tile of the Tagma receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Strength.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_BYZANTINE_TAGMA_NAME]Tagma

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_GAUL_GAESATAE_DESCRIPTION]Gallic unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Warrior. This unit has increased cost and receives +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting units with a higher base Combat Strength. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_GAUL_GAESATAE_NAME]Gaesatae
